name: Cheesy Chile Eggrolls
author: Culinary Envy
summary: Cheesy chile eggrolls are just 3 simple ingredients! Crispy, hot, cheesy, slightly spicy appetizer that everyone will love!
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package large egg roll wrappers (such as Nasoya®)
2 (7 ounce) cans whole fire-roasted mild green chiles (such as La Victoria®), or more to taste
1 ½ cups canola oil for frying
directions: Place eggroll wraps on a work surface
Place 1 whole green chile diagonally on the wrap
Add about 2 tablespoons pepper Jack cheese, or enough to cover chile
Roll snugly halfway to cover filling
Fold in both sides snugly against filling to look like an envelope; moisten edges of last flap with a moistened finger
Roll wrap up and seal top corner using water again to moisten edges to make them stick
Lay flap-side down until ready to cook
Heat canola oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat to 350°F
Lower eggrolls with the flap side down carefully into the hot oil in batches
Fry until golden, turning occasionally, 2 to 3 minutes
Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain
